medical_history.chief_complaint: Anorexia nervosa and symptoms related to gastrointestinal stromal tumors.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: At age 14, following pressure to lose weight from his baseball coach and peer teasing, Alex began dieting. Initially restricting high-fat foods, he later severely limited his intake and lost 100 lb over 7-8 months. Symptoms of fainting and bleeding began at age 16, leading to the discovery of a gastric tumor, which was surgically removed. His weight at the time was 101 lb at admission. Despite treatment, he struggled with food restriction, severe laxative abuse, and relapsed multiple times.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Alex had a significant history of anorexia nervosa and a history of gastrointestinal stromal tumors, which were surgically removed but recur with metastases.
medical_history.family_history: There was no family history of mental illness or eating disorders. His parents divorced when he was 6 years old and had difficulty controlling his behavior.
medical_history.social_history: Alex was a talented athlete and was previously mildly overweight. He had a past pattern of high calorie-counting, significant exercise routines, and a lifestyle that included manipulating caregivers to tend to his disordered eating behaviors.
